Last apache 2.0.49-dev compiled from snapshots.

Configure string is:
CFLAGS="-DBIG_SECURITY_HOLE -D_XOPEN_SOURCE=500 -D__EXTENSIONS__ -
DAPR_HAS_SENDFILE -DAPR_HAS_MMAP" \
./configure \
--enable-so \
--enable-modules=all \
--disable-ipv6 \
--disable-vhost-alias \
--disable-auth-ldap \
--disable-isapi \
--disable-suexec \
--disable-proxy \
--enable-ssl \
--disable-ldap \
--disable-auth-dbm \
--disable-auth-db \
--disable-userdir \
--enable-charset-lite \
--enable-status \
--enable-rewrite \
--enable-cgi \
--enable-cgid \
--enable-so \
--enable-static-rotatelogs \
--enable-threads \
--with-mpm=perchild \
--with-program-name=httpd2 \
--prefix=/usr/local/httpd

On the request to the vhost where ChildPerUserID is set, server is no answer 
send and "[warn] (22)Invalid argument: apr_socket_opt_set: (TCP_NODELAY)" 
writing in server logs.
creator: pk@nodex.ru

text:
EINVAL when trying to set TCP_NODELAY option usually means that the connection
to the client has been lost already.  Presumably it has been lost due to
something bad which perchild has done ;)

In case it isn't obvious, no Apache developers have done any work with perchild
in quite a long time, other than trying to keep perchild up to date with changes
that have been made to the other MPMs.  Please consider the current experimental
module  as a proving ground for some good ideas, but something that should be
left alone by folks not interested in debugging problems in it.
creator: trawick@apache.org

text:
are you sure you dont mean apr_socket_opt_set(APR_TCP_NODELAY)

TCP_NODELAY = 1 whereas
APR_TCP_NODELAY = 512

this may be related to bug 30004
